title: prysm 4.2.0 shuts down with an error "SIGILL: illegal instruction"
body:
### Describe the bug

After the hard fork "Cancun" described in the [new version](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/releases/tag/v1.13.10) of go-etherium, stopped synchronizing in the Goerli network.
Synchronization stopped due to the prism container being turned off.

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

```text
Everything worked on versions:
geth - v1.13.9
prysm - v4.1.1
```


### ðŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction

<details closed> 
<summary> 1. I'm started container like below: </summary>

```
  prysm:
    container_name: ${PRYSM_CONTAINER_NAME}
    image: ${PRYSM_IMAGE}
    depends_on:
      - geth
    volumes: 
      - ${HOST_DATADIR}:${DATADIR}
    ports:
      - "${PRYSM_PEER_LISTEN_ADDR}:${PRYSM_PEER_LISTEN_PORT}:13000"
      - "${PRYSM_NODE_LISTEN_ADDR}:${PRYSM_NODE_LISTEN_PORT}:12000/udp"
    stop_grace_period: 1m30s
    command: 
      --datadir=${DATADIR}
      --jwt-secret=${JWTSECRET_PATH}
      --rpc-host=0.0.0.0
      --grpc-gateway-host=0.0.0.0
      --monitoring-host=0.0.0.0
      --execution-endpoint=${PRYSM_EXECUTION_ENDPOINT}
      --accept-terms-of-use
      --${BLOCKCHAIN_NET}
      ${PRYSM_ADDITIONAL_COMMAND}
```

</details>

<details closed>
<summary> 2. Prism works for 5-10 minutes with logs like: </summary>

```                                                                                 
time="2024-01-18 14:27:02" level=info msg="Node started p2p server" multiAddr="/ip4/172.18.0.3/tcp/13000/p2p/[secret_string???]" prefix=p2p                                                                                                                  
time="2024-01-18 14:27:07" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=3 suitable=0          
time="2024-01-18 14:27:12" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=3 suitable=0          
time="2024-01-18 14:27:12" level=info msg="Connected to new endpoint: /***" prefix=execution                                                    
time="2024-01-18 14:27:17" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=3 suitable=0
time="2024-01-18 14:27:26" level=info msg="Processing block batch of size 22 starting from  0xf2c2e73c... 7413698/7423337 - estimated time remai
ning 2h26m2s" blocksPerSecond=1.1 peers=4 prefix=initial-sync
time="2024-01-18 14:28:02" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=3 suitable=0
time="2024-01-18 14:28:02" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=2 inbound=0 outbound=1 prefix=p2p
time="2024-01-18 14:28:07" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=3 suitable=2
time="2024-01-18 14:29:02" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=15 inbound=0 outbound=15 prefix=p2p
time="2024-01-18 14:29:46" level=info msg="Processing block batch of size 42 starting from  0x60ab3457... 7413727/7423348 - estimated time remai
ning 1h16m21s" blocksPerSecond=2.1 peers=14 prefix=initial-sync
time="2024-01-18 14:30:02" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=12 inbound=2 outbound=7 prefix=p2p
time="2024-01-18 14:30:05" level=info msg="Called new payload with optimistic block" payloadBlockHash=0x8db647a21226 prefix=blockchain slot=7413
762
time="2024-01-18 14:30:05" level=info msg="Called new payload with optimistic block" payloadBlockHash=0xfebe087b7de5 prefix=blockchain slot=7413
763
```

</details>

3. I get an error and prism is disabled

### Error

```text
time="2024-01-18 14:30:05" level=info msg="Called new payload with optimistic block" payloadBlockHash=0xfebe087b7de5 prefix=blockchai[3508/7353]
763                                                                                                                                             
time="2024-01-18 14:30:05" level=info msg="Called new payload with optimistic block" payloadBlockHash=0x9ccb3ba48b23 prefix=blockchain slot=7413
766                                                                                                                                             
time="2024-01-18 14:30:06" level=info msg="Called new payload with optimistic block" payloadBlockHash=0x9e1658245657 prefix=blockchain slot=7413
769                                                                                                                                             
SIGILL: illegal instruction                                                                                                                     
PC=0x215949c m=5 sigcode=2
instruction bytes: 0xc5 0x7a 0x6f 0x2d 0xbc 0xe9 0xbb 0xfe 0xc5 0x7a 0x6f 0x15 0x24 0x9e 0xb9 0xfe
goroutine 29952 [running]:
github.com/prysmaticlabs/gohashtree._hash(0xc04704fc80, {0xc04704fc80, 0x2, 0x2}, 0x1)
        external/com_github_prysmaticlabs_gohashtree/hash_amd64.s:1061 +0x79dc fp=0xc04045b568 sp=0xc04045b1b8 pc=0x215949c
created by github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/v4/runtime.(*ServiceRegistry).StartAll in goroutine 1
        runtime/service_registry.go:46 +0xe7
goroutine 1 [chan receive, 3 minutes]:
runtime.gopark(...)
        GOROOT/src/runtime/proc.go:398
runtime.chanrecv(0xc000538900, 0x0, 0x1)
        GOROOT/src/runtime/chan.go:583 +0x5ae fp=0xc043e47840 sp=0xc043e47778 pc=0x1c978ce
runtime.chanrecv1(0xc0004ae6a8?, 0xc000000004?)
        GOROOT/src/runtime/chan.go:442 +0x12 fp=0xc043e47868 sp=0xc043e47840 pc=0x1c972f2
github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/v4/beacon-chain/node.(*BeaconNode).Start(0xc0004ae680)
        beacon-chain/node/node.go:375 +0x1a8 fp=0xc043e47a08 sp=0xc043e47868 pc=0x3258908
main.startNode(0x1c9fb25?, 0x18?)
        cmd/beacon-chain/main.go:305 +0x76a fp=0xc043e47b90 sp=0xc043e47a08 pc=0x326b5ca
main.main.func1(0xc000416160?)
```


### Platform(s)

_No response_

### What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)

4.2.0

### Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?

I tried using other versions suggested in other issues:
1. [Comment](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/issues/13478#issuecomment-1895509660) - Image `gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:HEAD-fe431b`
2. [Comment](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/issues/13483#issuecomment-1897991073) - version [v4.2.1-rc.0](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/releases/tag/v4.2.1-rc.0)

But I get the same errors.

I'm running a node on a virtual machine QEMU KVM with 4 threads of `Intel(R) Xeon(R) Gold 6348 CPU @ 2.60GHz`
please can you post a little more on the execution environment? this is QEMU of x86_64 with host being  the same architecture? Did you run the same exact environment before?
Could you also check if QEMU's version has changed?

Hi @potuz sorry my english.

PRYSM 4.2.0
geth version 1.13.5-stable-916d6a44

It's been two days since my node stops validating, and I have to restart all the geth, prysm (beacon and validator) and mevboost services, since only if the beacon is restarted it doesn't work, I think it is not the same problem, but I have virtualized in proxmox in HOST mode

Beacon service

@potuz 
> please can you post a little more on the execution environment? this is QEMU of x86_64 with host being the same architecture? Did you run the same exact environment before?

Yes, the host and VM have the same architecture - x86_64 both on Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS.
The host and VM have been operating without changes in configuration for more than a year, prysm runs in the container into VM and changes occur only in it.

> Could you also check if QEMU's version has changed?
```
$ qemu-system-x86_64 --version
QEMU emulator version 4.2.1 (Debian 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.28)
```
According to the logs, QEMU packages updated 2024-01-09 to the current version.

But I don't think the problem is with the update, because. The problems started right at the moment of the hard fork
> Deneb Goerli Support
>This release adds in full support for the upcoming deneb hard fork on goerli next week on January 17th.

https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/releases/tag/v4.2.0

@potuz 
And one more thing, the problem is only in the geth test network (Goerli), 2 mainnet nodes work well.

I'm back to version of prysm 4.2.0 and update geth to 1.13.11
